chinese.question: 如果伊达尔戈的油画被陈列在2号墙上，那么以下哪一个也可以被陈列在2号墙上？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 在一个即将举行的展览上，四个艺术学生--弗兰兹、格林、伊达尔戈和艾萨克斯--将各自展示正好两幅画--一幅油画和一幅水彩。恰好两幅画将被展示在展览室的每一面墙上--1号、2号、3号和4号墙--一幅画在上面的位置，一幅在下面的位置。以下条件将适用：没有一面墙只展示水彩画。没有一面墙只展示一个学生的作品。没有一面墙同时展示Franz的画和Isaacs的画。格林的水彩画被展示在弗兰兹的油画所展示的墙的上部位置。艾萨克斯的油画被展示在4号墙的下部位置。

english.passage: At an upcoming exhibition, four art students—Franz, Greene, Hidalgo, and Isaacs—will each display exactly two paintings—an oil and a watercolor. Exactly two paintings will be displayed on each of the walls of the exhibition room—walls 1, 2, 3, and 4—with one painting in the upper position and one in the lower position. The following conditions will apply: No wall has only watercolors displayed on it. No wall has the work of only one student displayed on it. No wall has both a painting by Franz and a painting by Isaacs displayed on it. Greene's watercolor is displayed in the upper position of the wall on which Franz's oil is displayed. Isaacs's oil is displayed in the lower position of wall 4.
english.question: If Hidalgo's oil is displayed on wall 2, which one of the following could also be displayed on wall 2?
options: (A)Franz's oil
(B)Greene's watercolor
(C)Greene's oil
(D)Hidalgo's watercolor
(E)Isaacs's watercolor
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (E)Isaacs's watercolor
english.background: At an upcoming exhibition, four art students—Franz, Greene, Hidalgo, and Isaacs—will each display exactly two paintings—an oil and a watercolor. Exactly two paintings will be displayed on each of the walls of the exhibition room—walls 1, 2, 3, and 4—with one painting in the upper position and one in the lower position. The following conditions will apply: No wall has only watercolors displayed on it. No wall has the work of only one student displayed on it. No wall has both a painting by Franz and a painting by Isaacs displayed on it. Greene's watercolor is displayed in the upper position of the wall on which Franz's oil is displayed. Isaacs's oil is displayed in the lower position of wall 4.

chinese.question: 如果培恩不在队里，以下哪项可能是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (A)迈尔斯和奥特加都不在队里。
(B)迈尔斯和汤姆森都不在队里。
(D)奥特加和汤姆森都不在队里。
(E)奥特加和约德尔都不在队里。
chinese.background: 一位公司经理正在为一个研究小组挑选员工。该团队将包括至少四名员工，都来自以下八个人中：Myers, Ortega, Paine, Schmidt, Thomson, Wong, Yoder, and Zayre.选择受到以下条件的限制：如果迈尔斯在团队中，奥特加和佩恩都不能在团队中。如果施密特在队中，培恩和汤姆森也必须在队中。如果王在队里，迈尔斯和约德尔也必须是。

english.passage: A corporate manager is selecting employees for a research team. The team will include at least four employees, all from among the following eight: Myers, Ortega, Paine, Schmidt, Thomson, Wong, Yoder, and Zayre. The selection is constrained by the following conditions: If Myers is on the team, neither Ortega nor Paine can be. If Schmidt is on the team, both Paine and Thomson must also be. If Wong is on the team, both Myers and Yoder must also be.
english.question: If Paine is not on the team, which one of the following could be true?
options: (A)Neither Myers nor Ortega is on the team.
(B)Neither Myers nor Thomson is on the team.
(C)Neither Myers nor Zayre is on the team.
(D)Neither Ortega nor Thomson is on the team.
(E)Neither Ortega nor Yoder is on the team.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (D)Neither Ortega nor Thomson is on the team.
choices: (A)Neither Myers nor Ortega is on the team.
(B)Neither Myers nor Thomson is on the team.
(C)Neither Myers nor Zayre is on the team.
(D)Neither Ortega nor Thomson is on the team.
(E)Neither Ortega nor Yoder is on the team.
english.background: A corporate manager is selecting employees for a research team. The team will include at least four employees, all from among the following eight: Myers, Ortega, Paine, Schmidt, Thomson, Wong, Yoder, and Zayre. The selection is constrained by the following conditions: If Myers is on the team, neither Ortega nor Paine can be. If Schmidt is on the team, both Paine and Thomson must also be. If Wong is on the team, both Myers and Yoder must also be.

chinese.question: 如果关于燕鸥的讲座是在霍华德礼堂进行的，那么以下哪一个可能是第三场讲座的事实？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (A)它是关于牡蛎的，并且是在Gladwyn厅。
(D)它在鹬鸟身上，在霍华德礼堂。
chinese.background: 一位博物学家将举办五场讲座，每场都是关于不同类型的鸟类：蛎鹬、海燕、钢轨、鹬鸟或燕鸥。讲座必须在格拉德温厅或霍华德礼堂进行，其顺序应符合以下条件：第一场讲座是在格拉德温厅。第四场讲座是在霍华德礼堂。恰好有三个讲座是在格拉德温厅。鹬蚌相争的讲座在霍华德礼堂举行，并且比蛎鹬的讲座早。关于燕鸥的讲座比关于海燕的讲座早，后者在格拉德温厅。

english.passage: A naturalist will give five lectures, each on a different type of bird: oystercatchers, petrels, rails, sandpipers, or terns. The lectures must be given in either Gladwyn Hall or Howard Auditorium, in an order that meets the following conditions: The first lecture is in Gladwyn Hall. The fourth lecture is in Howard Auditorium. Exactly three of the lectures are in Gladwyn Hall. The lecture on sandpipers is in Howard Auditorium and is given earlier than the lecture on oystercatchers. The lecture on terns is given earlier than the lecture on petrels, which is in Gladwyn Hall.
english.question: If the lecture on terns is given in Howard Auditorium, which one of the following could be true of the third lecture?
options: (A)It is on oystercatchers and is in Gladwyn Hall.
(B)It is on rails and is in Howard Auditorium.
(C)It is on rails and is in Gladwyn Hall.
(D)It is on sandpipers and is in Howard Auditorium.
(E)It is on terns and is in Howard Auditorium.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (A)It is on oystercatchers and is in Gladwyn Hall.
choices: (A)It is on oystercatchers and is in Gladwyn Hall.
(B)It is on rails and is in Howard Auditorium.
(C)It is on rails and is in Gladwyn Hall.
(D)It is on sandpipers and is in Howard Auditorium.
(E)It is on terns and is in Howard Auditorium.
english.background: A naturalist will give five lectures, each on a different type of bird: oystercatchers, petrels, rails, sandpipers, or terns. The lectures must be given in either Gladwyn Hall or Howard Auditorium, in an order that meets the following conditions: The first lecture is in Gladwyn Hall. The fourth lecture is in Howard Auditorium. Exactly three of the lectures are in Gladwyn Hall. The lecture on sandpipers is in Howard Auditorium and is given earlier than the lecture on oystercatchers. The lecture on terns is given earlier than the lecture on petrels, which is in Gladwyn Hall.

chinese.question: 如果Tao是第二个被招募的，那么以下哪一项可能是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 一名侦探正试图确定一名罪犯招募七名同伙的顺序--彼得斯、奎因、罗维罗、斯坦顿、陶、维拉斯和怀特。除了发现嫌疑人是一个一个地招募同伙外，侦探还确定了以下情况：斯坦顿既不是在陶某之前也不是在陶某之后被招募的。奎因被招募的时间早于罗维罗。维拉斯是在怀特之前被招募的。彼得斯是第四个被招募的。

english.passage: A detective is trying to determine the order in which a criminal recruited seven accomplices—Peters, Quinn, Rovero, Stanton, Tao, Villas, and White. In addition to discovering that the suspect recruited the accomplices one at a time, the detective has established the following: Stanton was recruited neither immediately before nor immediately after Tao. Quinn was recruited earlier than Rovero. Villas was recruited immediately before White. Peters was recruited fourth.
english.question: If Tao was recruited second, which one of the following could be true?
options: (A)Quinn was recruited third.
(B)Rovero was recruited fifth.
(C)Stanton was recruited sixth.
(D)Villas was recruited sixth.
(E)White was recruited third.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (D)Villas was recruited sixth.
english.background: A detective is trying to determine the order in which a criminal recruited seven accomplices—Peters, Quinn, Rovero, Stanton, Tao, Villas, and White. In addition to discovering that the suspect recruited the accomplices one at a time, the detective has established the following: Stanton was recruited neither immediately before nor immediately after Tao. Quinn was recruited earlier than Rovero. Villas was recruited immediately before White. Peters was recruited fourth.

chinese.question: 如果用以下哪一项来代替这两家餐馆必须至少被另外两家企业隔开的约束条件，在确定企业的位置方面会有相同的效果？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (A)一家餐馆必须在空间3，空间4，或空间5。
(B)餐馆必须在验光师或兽医的旁边。
(C)玩具店或兽医必须在两个餐馆之间的某个地方。
(D)药店和离它最近的餐馆之间不能有超过两个企业。
chinese.background: 一个购物中心正好有七个空间--空间1到空间7--排成一直线。七家企业--一家验光师、一家药店、两家餐馆、一家鞋店、一家玩具店和一家兽医--将被安置在购物中心内，每个空间都有一家。这些企业的位置受到以下限制：药店必须位于这一排的一端，其中一家餐馆位于另一端。这两家餐馆必须至少被另外两家企业分开。药店必须在验光师或兽医的旁边。玩具店不能在兽医的旁边。

english.passage: A shopping center has exactly seven spaces—space 1 through space 7—arranged in a straight row. Seven businesses—an optometrist, a pharmacy, two restaurants, a shoe store, a toy store, and a veterinarian—will be located in the shopping center, one in each space. The locations of the businesses are subject to the following constraints: The pharmacy must be at one end of the row and one of the restaurants at the other. The two restaurants must be separated by at least two other businesses. The pharmacy must be next to either the optometrist or the veterinarian. The toy store cannot be next to the veterinarian.
english.question: Which one of the following, if substituted for the constraint that the two restaurants must be separated by at least two other businesses, would have the same effect in determining the locations of the businesses?
options: (A)A restaurant must be in either space 3, space 4, or space 5.
(B)A restaurant must be next to either the optometrist or the veterinarian.
(C)Either the toy store or the veterinarian must be somewhere between the two restaurants.
(D)No more than two businesses can separate the pharmacy and the restaurant nearest it.
(E)The optometrist cannot be next to the shoe store.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (D)No more than two businesses can separate the pharmacy and the restaurant nearest it.
choices: (A)A restaurant must be in either space 3, space 4, or space 5.
(B)A restaurant must be next to either the optometrist or the veterinarian.
(C)Either the toy store or the veterinarian must be somewhere between the two restaurants.
(D)No more than two businesses can separate the pharmacy and the restaurant nearest it.
(E)The optometrist cannot be next to the shoe store.
english.background: A shopping center has exactly seven spaces—space 1 through space 7—arranged in a straight row. Seven businesses—an optometrist, a pharmacy, two restaurants, a shoe store, a toy store, and a veterinarian—will be located in the shopping center, one in each space. The locations of the businesses are subject to the following constraints: The pharmacy must be at one end of the row and one of the restaurants at the other. The two restaurants must be separated by at least two other businesses. The pharmacy must be next to either the optometrist or the veterinarian. The toy store cannot be next to the veterinarian.

chinese.question: 如果森林色和桃红色在一块地毯上一起使用，以下哪项可能是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (B)在任何一张地毯中都没有使用白色。
(C)在任何地毯中都没有使用黄色。
(D)绿松石和白色一起被用在地毯上。
(E)绿松石和黄色一起用在一张地毯上。
chinese.background: 三块地毯将用彩色的线织成。有六种颜色的线--森林色、橄榄色、桃红色、绿松石色、白色和黄色，其中正好有五种颜色将被用来编织地毯。每种颜色都只用在其中一块地毯上。地毯要么是纯色的，要么是单色的，要么是多色的。地毯必须按照以下规则进行编织：在任何使用白色的地毯中，也要使用其他两种颜色。在任何使用橄榄色的地毯中，也要使用桃色。森林色和绿松石色不能一起使用在地毯上。桃红色和绿松石色不能一起使用在地毯上。桃色和黄色不在一张地毯中一起使用。

english.passage: Three rugs will be woven out of colored thread. Six colors of thread are available—forest, olive, peach, turquoise, white, and yellow—exactly five of which will be used to weave the rugs. Each color that is used will be used in only one of the rugs. The rugs are either solid—woven in a single color—or multicolored. The rugs must be woven according to the following rules: In any rug in which white is used, two other colors are also used. In any rug in which olive is used, peach is also used. Forest and turquoise are not used together in a rug. Peach and turquoise are not used together in a rug. Peach and yellow are not used together in a rug.
english.question: If forest and peach are used together in a rug, which one of the following could be true?
options: (A)There is exactly one solid rug.
(B)White is not used in any of the rugs.
(C)Yellow is not used in any of the rugs.
(D)Turquoise and white are used together in a rug.
(E)Turquoise and yellow are used together in a rug.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (B)White is not used in any of the rugs.
choices: (B)White is not used in any of the rugs.
(C)Yellow is not used in any of the rugs.
(D)Turquoise and white are used together in a rug.
(E)Turquoise and yellow are used together in a rug.
english.background: Three rugs will be woven out of colored thread. Six colors of thread are available—forest, olive, peach, turquoise, white, and yellow—exactly five of which will be used to weave the rugs. Each color that is used will be used in only one of the rugs. The rugs are either solid—woven in a single color—or multicolored. The rugs must be woven according to the following rules: In any rug in which white is used, two other colors are also used. In any rug in which olive is used, peach is also used. Forest and turquoise are not used together in a rug. Peach and turquoise are not used together in a rug. Peach and yellow are not used together in a rug.

chinese.question: 如果杰克逊被安排在星期三作证，那么以下哪项安排一定是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (B)加西亚被安排在星期一作证。
(C)正好有一个证人被安排在星期一作证。
(D)正好有两个证人计划在星期一作证。
(E)加西亚被安排在与洪秀柱的同一天作证。
chinese.background: 恰好有五位证人-Franco, Garcia, Hong, Iturbe, 和Jackson被安排在一个听证会上作证，该听证会恰好在一周中的三天--周一、周二和周三举行。每个证人正好在听证会的一天作证。该时间表必须满足以下条件：弗朗科不在加西亚作证的同一天作证。伊图尔贝在星期三作证。恰好有两名证人在星期二作证。Hong不在周一作证。至少有一名证人在周一作证。

english.passage: Exactly five witnesses—Franco, Garcia, Hong, Iturbe, and Jackson—are to be scheduled to testify at a hearing that is to take exactly three days of one week—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Each witness testifies on exactly one day of the hearing. The schedule must meet the following conditions: Franco does not testify on the same day that Garcia testifies. Iturbe testifies on Wednesday. Exactly two witnesses testify on Tuesday. Hong does not testify on Monday. At least one witness testifies on Monday.
english.question: If Jackson is scheduled to testify on Wednesday, which one of the following must be true of the schedule?
options: (A)Franco is scheduled to testify on Monday.
(B)Garcia is scheduled to testify on Monday.
(C)Exactly one witness is scheduled to testify on Monday.
(D)Exactly two witnesses are scheduled to testify on Monday.
(E)Garcia is scheduled to testify on the same day as Hong.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (C)Exactly one witness is scheduled to testify on Monday.
choices: (A)Franco is scheduled to testify on Monday.
(B)Garcia is scheduled to testify on Monday.
(C)Exactly one witness is scheduled to testify on Monday.
(D)Exactly two witnesses are scheduled to testify on Monday.
(E)Garcia is scheduled to testify on the same day as Hong.
english.background: Exactly five witnesses—Franco, Garcia, Hong, Iturbe, and Jackson—are to be scheduled to testify at a hearing that is to take exactly three days of one week—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Each witness testifies on exactly one day of the hearing. The schedule must meet the following conditions: Franco does not testify on the same day that Garcia testifies. Iturbe testifies on Wednesday. Exactly two witnesses testify on Tuesday. Hong does not testify on Monday. At least one witness testifies on Monday.

chinese.question: 以下哪一项可以完全分配给席尔瓦大学仪式的摄影师？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 一家摄影企业的经理必须为两场毕业典礼各指派至少两名摄影师--一场在希尔瓦大学，另一场在索恩大学。恰好有六位摄影师--Frost、Gonzalez、Heideck、Knutson、Lai和Mays，但不是所有的摄影师都必须被指派。没有摄影师可以被分配到两个仪式上。以下是一些限制条件：Frost必须和Heideck一起被分配到其中一个毕业典礼上。如果Lai和Mays都被分配到，必须是不同的仪式。如果冈萨雷斯被分配到席尔瓦大学的仪式上，那么莱必须被分配到索恩大学的仪式上。如果Knutson没有被分配到索恩大学的仪式，那么Heideck和Mays都必须被分配到该仪式。

english.passage: The manager of a photography business must assign at least two photographers to each of two graduation ceremonies—one at Silva University and the other at Thorne University. Exactly six photographers are available—Frost, Gonzalez, Heideck, Knutson, Lai, and Mays—but not all have to be assigned. No photographer can be assigned to both ceremonies. The following constraints apply: Frost must be assigned together with Heideck to one of the graduation ceremonies. If Lai and Mays are both assigned, it must be to different ceremonies. If Gonzalez is assigned to the Silva University ceremony, then Lai must be assigned to the Thorne University ceremony. If Knutson is not assigned to the Thorne University ceremony, then both Heideck and Mays must be assigned to it.
english.question: Which one of the following could be the complete assignment of photographers to the Silva University ceremony?
options: (A)Frost, Gonzalez, Heideck, Knutson
(B)Frost, Gonzalez, Heideck
(C)Gonzalez, Knutson
(D)Heideck, Lai
(E)Knutson, Mays
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (B)Frost, Gonzalez, Heideck
english.background: The manager of a photography business must assign at least two photographers to each of two graduation ceremonies—one at Silva University and the other at Thorne University. Exactly six photographers are available—Frost, Gonzalez, Heideck, Knutson, Lai, and Mays—but not all have to be assigned. No photographer can be assigned to both ceremonies. The following constraints apply: Frost must be assigned together with Heideck to one of the graduation ceremonies. If Lai and Mays are both assigned, it must be to different ceremonies. If Gonzalez is assigned to the Silva University ceremony, then Lai must be assigned to the Thorne University ceremony. If Knutson is not assigned to the Thorne University ceremony, then both Heideck and Mays must be assigned to it.

chinese.question: 如果杰克逊是唯一安排在周一作证的证人，那么以下哪项安排一定是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (E)加西亚定于与洪秀柱同一天作证。
chinese.background: 恰好有五位证人--佛朗哥、加西亚、洪、伊图尔贝和杰克逊被安排在听证会上作证，听证会恰好在一周中的三天进行--星期一、星期二和星期三。每个证人正好在听证会的一天作证。该时间表必须满足以下条件：弗朗科不在加西亚作证的同一天作证。伊图尔贝在星期三作证。恰好有两名证人在星期二作证。洪秀柱在星期一不作证。至少有一名证人在周一作证。

english.passage: Exactly five witnesses—Franco, Garcia, Hong, Iturbe, and Jackson—are to be scheduled to testify at a hearing that is to take exactly three days of one week—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Each witness testifies on exactly one day of the hearing. The schedule must meet the following conditions: Franco does not testify on the same day that Garcia testifies. Iturbe testifies on Wednesday. Exactly two witnesses testify on Tuesday. Hong does not testify on Monday. At least one witness testifies on Monday.
english.question: If Jackson is the only witness scheduled to testify on Monday, which one of the following must be true of the schedule?
options: (A)Franco is scheduled to testify on Wednesday.
(B)Hong is scheduled to testify on Tuesday.
(C)Garcia is scheduled to testify on Tuesday.
(D)Franco is scheduled to testify on the same day as Hong.
(E)Garcia is scheduled to testify on the same day as Hong.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (B)Hong is scheduled to testify on Tuesday.
choices: (A)Franco is scheduled to testify on Wednesday.
(B)Hong is scheduled to testify on Tuesday.
(C)Garcia is scheduled to testify on Tuesday.
(D)Franco is scheduled to testify on the same day as Hong.
(E)Garcia is scheduled to testify on the same day as Hong.
english.background: Exactly five witnesses—Franco, Garcia, Hong, Iturbe, and Jackson—are to be scheduled to testify at a hearing that is to take exactly three days of one week—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Each witness testifies on exactly one day of the hearing. The schedule must meet the following conditions: Franco does not testify on the same day that Garcia testifies. Iturbe testifies on Wednesday. Exactly two witnesses testify on Tuesday. Hong does not testify on Monday. At least one witness testifies on Monday.

chinese.question: 如果其中一块地毯是纯桃色的，那么以下哪一项一定是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (B)其中一张地毯是纯绿松石色的。
(D)森林色和白色一起被用在地毯上。
(E)白色和黄色一起用在地毯上。
chinese.background: 三块地毯将用彩色线织成。有六种颜色的线--森林色、橄榄色、桃红色、绿松石色、白色和黄色，其中正好有五种颜色将被用来织地毯。每种颜色都只用在其中一块地毯上。地毯要么是纯色的，要么是单色的，要么是多色的。地毯必须按照以下规则进行编织：在任何使用白色的地毯中，也要使用其他两种颜色。在任何使用橄榄色的地毯中，也要使用桃色。森林色和绿松石色不能一起使用在地毯上。桃红色和绿松石色不能一起使用在地毯上。桃色和黄色不在一张地毯中一起使用。

english.passage: Three rugs will be woven out of colored thread. Six colors of thread are available—forest, olive, peach, turquoise, white, and yellow—exactly five of which will be used to weave the rugs. Each color that is used will be used in only one of the rugs. The rugs are either solid—woven in a single color—or multicolored. The rugs must be woven according to the following rules: In any rug in which white is used, two other colors are also used. In any rug in which olive is used, peach is also used. Forest and turquoise are not used together in a rug. Peach and turquoise are not used together in a rug. Peach and yellow are not used together in a rug.
english.question: If one of the rugs is solid peach, which one of the following must be true?
options: (A)One of the rugs is solid forest.
(B)One of the rugs is solid turquoise.
(C)One of the rugs is solid yellow.
(D)Forest and white are used together in a rug.
(E)White and yellow are used together in a rug.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (E)White and yellow are used together in a rug.
choices: (A)One of the rugs is solid forest.
(B)One of the rugs is solid turquoise.
(C)One of the rugs is solid yellow.
(D)Forest and white are used together in a rug.
(E)White and yellow are used together in a rug.
english.background: Three rugs will be woven out of colored thread. Six colors of thread are available—forest, olive, peach, turquoise, white, and yellow—exactly five of which will be used to weave the rugs. Each color that is used will be used in only one of the rugs. The rugs are either solid—woven in a single color—or multicolored. The rugs must be woven according to the following rules: In any rug in which white is used, two other colors are also used. In any rug in which olive is used, peach is also used. Forest and turquoise are not used together in a rug. Peach and turquoise are not used together in a rug. Peach and yellow are not used together in a rug.

chinese.question: 以下哪一个列表可以准确地识别出装货码头前三个货舱中每一个货舱中所存放的货物，按顺序从货舱1到货舱3排列？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 一个装货码头由恰好六个货舱组成，从码头的一侧到另一侧连续编号为1到6。每个货舱都有六种不同的货物--燃料、谷物、牲畜、机械、农产品或纺织品。以下情况适用：装粮食的港湾比装牲畜的港湾的数字要高。装载牲畜的舱位比装载纺织品的舱位数量多。存放农产品的仓库比存放燃料的仓库数量多。储存纺织品的海湾紧挨着储存农产品的海湾。

english.passage: A loading dock consists of exactly six bays numbered 1 through 6 consecutively from one side of the dock to the other. Each bay is holding a different one of exactly six types of cargo—fuel, grain, livestock, machinery, produce, or textiles. The following apply: The bay holding grain has a higher number than the bay holding livestock. The bay holding livestock has a higher number than the bay holding textiles. The bay holding produce has a higher number than the bay holding fuel. The bay holding textiles is next to the bay holding produce.
english.question: Which one of the following lists could accurately identify the cargo held in each of the loading dock's first three bays, listed in order from bay 1 to bay 3?
options: (A)fuel, machinery, textiles
(B)grain, machinery, fuel
(C)machinery, livestock, fuel
(D)machinery, textiles, fuel
(E)machinery, textiles, produce
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (A)fuel, machinery, textiles
english.background: A loading dock consists of exactly six bays numbered 1 through 6 consecutively from one side of the dock to the other. Each bay is holding a different one of exactly six types of cargo—fuel, grain, livestock, machinery, produce, or textiles. The following apply: The bay holding grain has a higher number than the bay holding livestock. The bay holding livestock has a higher number than the bay holding textiles. The bay holding produce has a higher number than the bay holding fuel. The bay holding textiles is next to the bay holding produce.

chinese.question: 如果演奏第一段独奏的钢琴家也演奏第二段独奏，那么以下哪一项一定是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (D)第二段独奏是一首传统曲目。
(E)第四段独奏是一首现代乐曲。
chinese.background: 在一场独奏会中，两位钢琴家--韦恩和扎拉--将进行独奏。总共将有五首独奏，紧接着进行。每个独奏都将是一首现代作品或传统作品。钢琴家的选择和独奏曲的类型必须符合以下条件：第三次独奏是一首传统曲目。恰好有两首传统曲目是连续演奏的。在第四场独奏中，韦恩演奏一首传统曲目，或扎拉演奏一首现代曲目。演奏第二场独奏的钢琴家不演奏第五场独奏。在韦恩至少演奏一首现代乐曲之前，不演奏传统乐曲。

english.passage: During a recital, two pianists—Wayne and Zara—will perform solos. There will be five solos altogether, performed one immediately after another. Each solo will be either a modern piece or a traditional piece. The choice of pianist and type of piece for the solos must conform to the following conditions: The third solo is a traditional piece. Exactly two of the traditional pieces are performed consecutively. In the fourth solo, either Wayne performs a traditional piece or Zara performs a modern piece. The pianist who performs the second solo does not perform the fifth solo. No traditional piece is performed until Wayne performs at least one modem piece.
english.question: If the pianist who performs the first solo also performs the second solo, then which one of the following must be true?
options: (A)Zara performs the first solo.
(B)Wayne performs the third solo.
(C)Zara performs the fifth solo.
(D)The second solo is a traditional piece.
(E)The fourth solo is a modem piece.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (C)Zara performs the fifth solo.
choices: (D)The second solo is a traditional piece.
(E)The fourth solo is a modem piece.
english.background: During a recital, two pianists—Wayne and Zara—will perform solos. There will be five solos altogether, performed one immediately after another. Each solo will be either a modern piece or a traditional piece. The choice of pianist and type of piece for the solos must conform to the following conditions: The third solo is a traditional piece. Exactly two of the traditional pieces are performed consecutively. In the fourth solo, either Wayne performs a traditional piece or Zara performs a modern piece. The pianist who performs the second solo does not perform the fifth solo. No traditional piece is performed until Wayne performs at least one modem piece.

chinese.question: 如果第五首独奏是传统乐曲，那么对于究竟确定？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 在一场独奏会中，两位钢琴家--Wayne和Zara--将进行独奏。一共有五个独奏，一个紧接着一个进行。每首独奏都将是一首现代作品或传统作品。钢琴家的选择和独奏曲的类型必须符合以下条件：第三次独奏是一首传统曲目。恰好有两首传统曲目是连续演奏的。在第四场独奏中，韦恩演奏的是一首传统曲目，而扎拉演奏的是一首现代曲目。演奏第二场独奏的钢琴家不演奏第五场独奏。在韦恩至少演奏一首现代乐曲之前，不演奏传统乐曲。

english.passage: During a recital, two pianists—Wayne and Zara—will perform solos. There will be five solos altogether, performed one immediately after another. Each solo will be either a modern piece or a traditional piece. The choice of pianist and type of piece for the solos must conform to the following conditions: The third solo is a traditional piece. Exactly two of the traditional pieces are performed consecutively. In the fourth solo, either Wayne performs a traditional piece or Zara performs a modern piece. The pianist who performs the second solo does not perform the fifth solo. No traditional piece is performed until Wayne performs at least one modem piece.
english.question: If the fifth solo is a traditional piece, then for exactly determined?
options: (A)one
(B)two
(C)three
(D)four
(E)five
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (B)two
english.background: During a recital, two pianists—Wayne and Zara—will perform solos. There will be five solos altogether, performed one immediately after another. Each solo will be either a modern piece or a traditional piece. The choice of pianist and type of piece for the solos must conform to the following conditions: The third solo is a traditional piece. Exactly two of the traditional pieces are performed consecutively. In the fourth solo, either Wayne performs a traditional piece or Zara performs a modern piece. The pianist who performs the second solo does not perform the fifth solo. No traditional piece is performed until Wayne performs at least one modem piece.

chinese.question: 以下哪一项可能是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 一位作者正计划写一本由七章组成的神秘小说，即第1章到第7章。七条不同的线索-R、S、T、U、W、X和Z-每条都要准确地被提及一次，每章一条线索。提及线索的顺序要受到以下限制：T不能在第1章中提到。T必须在W之前被提到，而且提到T和提到W之间必须正好有两章的间隔。W和X不能在相邻的章节中提到。U和X必须在相邻的章节中提到。

english.passage: An author is planning to write a mystery novel consisting of seven chapters, chapter 1 through chapter 7. Each of seven different clues—R, S, T, U, W, X, and Z—is to be mentioned exactly once, one clue per chapter. The order in which the clues are mentioned is subject to the following constraints: T cannot be mentioned in chapter 1. T must be mentioned before W, and there must be exactly two chapters separating the mention of T from the mention of W. S and Z cannot be mentioned in adjacent chapters. W and X cannot be mentioned in adjacent chapters. U and X must be mentioned in adjacent chapters.
english.question: Which one of the following could be true?
options: (A)R is mentioned in chapter 7.
(B)T is mentioned in chapter 5.
(C)U is mentioned in chapter 7.
(D)W is mentioned in chapter 3.
(E)X is mentioned in chapter 6.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (A)R is mentioned in chapter 7.
english.background: An author is planning to write a mystery novel consisting of seven chapters, chapter 1 through chapter 7. Each of seven different clues—R, S, T, U, W, X, and Z—is to be mentioned exactly once, one clue per chapter. The order in which the clues are mentioned is subject to the following constraints: T cannot be mentioned in chapter 1. T must be mentioned before W, and there must be exactly two chapters separating the mention of T from the mention of W. S and Z cannot be mentioned in adjacent chapters. W and X cannot be mentioned in adjacent chapters. U and X must be mentioned in adjacent chapters.

chinese.question: 如果Veqemite在第三档表演，以下哪一项一定是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (A)不放心在比Xpert更早的档期表演。
chinese.background: 一个音乐会发起人正在填补一场慈善音乐会的六个空档。这些时段，从最早到最晚，被编号为时段一到时段六。这些时段将由六个乐队填补--Uneasy, Vegemite, Wellspring, Xpert, Yardsign, 和Zircon。每支乐队只在一个时段表演。顺序必须符合以下限制：Vegemite的表演时间比Zircon早。Wellspring和Zircon分别在比Xpert早的时段表演。Uneasy在最后三个位置中的一个进行表演。Yardsign在前三个位置中的一个位置表演。

english.passage: A concert promoter is filling the six slots at a benefit concert. The slots, from earliest to latest, are numbered slot one through slot six. The slots will be filled by six bands—Uneasy, Vegemite, Wellspring, Xpert, Yardsign, and Zircon. Each band will perform in just one slot. The order must meet the following constraints: Vegemite performs in an earlier slot than Zircon. Wellspring and Zircon each perform in an earlier slot than Xpert. Uneasy performs in one of the last three slots. Yardsign performs in one of the first three slots.
english.question: If Veqemite performs in slot three, which one of the following must be true?
options: (A)Uneasy performs in an earlier slot than Xpert.
(B)Wellspring performs in an earlier slot than zircon
(C)Xpert performs in an earlier slot than Uneasy
(D)Yardsign performs in an earlier slot than, wellspring
(E)Zircon performs in an earlier slot than Uneasy.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (B)Wellspring performs in an earlier slot than zircon
choices: (A)Uneasy performs in an earlier slot than Xpert.
(B)Wellspring performs in an earlier slot than zircon
(C)Xpert performs in an earlier slot than Uneasy
(D)Yardsign performs in an earlier slot than, wellspring
(E)Zircon performs in an earlier slot than Uneasy.
english.background: A concert promoter is filling the six slots at a benefit concert. The slots, from earliest to latest, are numbered slot one through slot six. The slots will be filled by six bands—Uneasy, Vegemite, Wellspring, Xpert, Yardsign, and Zircon. Each band will perform in just one slot. The order must meet the following constraints: Vegemite performs in an earlier slot than Zircon. Wellspring and Zircon each perform in an earlier slot than Xpert. Uneasy performs in one of the last three slots. Yardsign performs in one of the first three slots.

chinese.question: 如果正好有四位摄影师被分配到毕业典礼上，那么以下哪一位必须被分配到席尔瓦大学的典礼上？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 一家摄影企业的经理必须为两场毕业典礼各指派至少两名摄影师--一场在席尔瓦大学，另一场在索恩大学。恰好有六位摄影师--Frost、Gonzalez、Heideck、Knutson、Lai和Mays，但不是所有的摄影师都必须被指派。没有摄影师可以被分配到两个仪式上。以下是一些限制条件：Frost必须和Heideck一起被分配到其中一个毕业典礼上。如果Lai和Mays都被分配到，必须是不同的仪式。如果冈萨雷斯被分配到席尔瓦大学的仪式上，那么莱必须被分配到索恩大学的仪式上。如果Knutson没有被分配到索恩大学的仪式，那么Heideck和Mays都必须被分配到该仪式。

english.passage: The manager of a photography business must assign at least two photographers to each of two graduation ceremonies—one at Silva University and the other at Thorne University. Exactly six photographers are available—Frost, Gonzalez, Heideck, Knutson, Lai, and Mays—but not all have to be assigned. No photographer can be assigned to both ceremonies. The following constraints apply: Frost must be assigned together with Heideck to one of the graduation ceremonies. If Lai and Mays are both assigned, it must be to different ceremonies. If Gonzalez is assigned to the Silva University ceremony, then Lai must be assigned to the Thorne University ceremony. If Knutson is not assigned to the Thorne University ceremony, then both Heideck and Mays must be assigned to it.
english.question: If exactly four of the photographers are assigned to the graduation ceremonies, then which one of the following must be assigned to the Silva University ceremony?
options: (A)Frost
(B)Gonzalez
(C)Knutson
(D)Lai
(E)Mays
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (A)Frost
english.background: The manager of a photography business must assign at least two photographers to each of two graduation ceremonies—one at Silva University and the other at Thorne University. Exactly six photographers are available—Frost, Gonzalez, Heideck, Knutson, Lai, and Mays—but not all have to be assigned. No photographer can be assigned to both ceremonies. The following constraints apply: Frost must be assigned together with Heideck to one of the graduation ceremonies. If Lai and Mays are both assigned, it must be to different ceremonies. If Gonzalez is assigned to the Silva University ceremony, then Lai must be assigned to the Thorne University ceremony. If Knutson is not assigned to the Thorne University ceremony, then both Heideck and Mays must be assigned to it.

chinese.question: 如果正好有三个学生评论《起伏》，那么以下哪项可能是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 在学校的论文中，五名学生--蒋、克雷默、洛佩兹、梅格瑞安和奥尼尔--各自评论正好三个剧本中的一个或多个：日落》、《塔梅尔兰》和《起伏》，但不评论任何其他戏剧。以下条件必须适用：Kramer和Lopez各自评论的剧目比Megregian少。Lopez和Megregian都没有评论Jiang评论的任何剧本。Kramer和O'Neill都评论了Tamerlane。恰好有两名学生评论的剧目与对方完全相同。

english.passage: For the school paper, five students—Jiang, Kramer, Lopez, Megregian, and O'Neill—each review one or more of exactly three plays: Sunset, Tamerlane, and Undulation, but do not review any other plays. The following conditions must apply: Kramer and Lopez each review fewer of the plays than Megregian. Neither Lopez nor Megregian reviews any play Jiang reviews. Kramer and O'Neill both review Tamerlane. Exactly two of the students review exactly the same play or plays as each other.
english.question: If exactly three of the students review Undulation, which one of the following could be true?
options: (A)Megregian does not review Undulation.
(B)O'Neill does not review Undulation.
(C)Jiang reviews Undulation.
(D)Lopez reviews Tamerlane.
(E)O'Neill reviews Sunset.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (E)O'Neill reviews Sunset.
english.background: For the school paper, five students—Jiang, Kramer, Lopez, Megregian, and O'Neill—each review one or more of exactly three plays: Sunset, Tamerlane, and Undulation, but do not review any other plays. The following conditions must apply: Kramer and Lopez each review fewer of the plays than Megregian. Neither Lopez nor Megregian reviews any play Jiang reviews. Kramer and O'Neill both review Tamerlane. Exactly two of the students review exactly the same play or plays as each other.

chinese.question: 以下哪一项一定是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 一位老师将把五名学生--胡安娜、凯利、拉特法、梅和奥尔加中的每一个人恰好分配到两个研究小组中的一个，即绿队和红队。一个小组将有两名成员，另一个小组将有三名成员。每个小组的一名成员将被指定为主持人。该任务必须满足以下条件：胡安娜被分配到一个与奥尔加不同的小组。Lateefah被分配到绿色小组。凯利不是协调人。奥尔加是协调人。

english.passage: A teacher will assign each of five students—Juana, Kelly, Lateefah, Mei, and Olga—to exactly one of two research teams, the green team and the red team. One team will have two members, and the other will have three members. One member of each team will be designated as facilitator. The assignment must satisfy the following conditions: Juana is assigned to a different team than Olga is. Lateefah is assigned to the green team. Kelly is not a facilitator. Olga is a facilitator.
english.question: Which one of the following must be true?
options: (A)Juana is assigned to the red team.
(B)Lateefah is a facilitator.
(C)Olga is assigned to the green team.
(D)Juana and Mei are not both facilitators.
(E)Neither Juana nor Kelly is a facilitator.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (D)Juana and Mei are not both facilitators.
choices: (A)Juana is assigned to the red team.
(C)Olga is assigned to the green team.
(D)Juana and Mei are not both facilitators.
(E)Neither Juana nor Kelly is a facilitator.
english.background: A teacher will assign each of five students—Juana, Kelly, Lateefah, Mei, and Olga—to exactly one of two research teams, the green team and the red team. One team will have two members, and the other will have three members. One member of each team will be designated as facilitator. The assignment must satisfy the following conditions: Juana is assigned to a different team than Olga is. Lateefah is assigned to the green team. Kelly is not a facilitator. Olga is a facilitator.

chinese.question: 如果三个部分中的一个部分的两张照片都是盖格南的，那么以下哪一个可能是真的？
chinese.label: MUL
choices: (A)生活方式部分的两张照片都是Hue的作品。
(B)生活方式部分的一张照片是Fuentes拍摄的，一张是Hue拍摄的。
(C)Metro部分的两张照片都是Fuentes的作品。
(D)地铁部分的一张照片是Gagnon拍摄的，一张是Hue拍摄的。
(E)体育部分的两张照片都是Hue的作品。
chinese.background: 在明天的报纸的生活方式、地铁和体育部分，总共要出现六张不同的照片，每个部分正好两张照片。每张可用的照片都是由三位摄影师中的一位拍摄的：Fuentes、Gagnon和Hue。照片的选择受到以下条件的限制：对于每个摄影师，必须出现该摄影师的至少一张但不超过三张的照片。生活方式部分至少有一张照片必须是由在地铁部分至少有一张照片的摄影师拍摄的。生活方式版块中Hue的照片数量必须与体育版块中Fuentes的照片数量相同。加尼翁的照片都不能出现在体育版中。

english.passage: In the Lifestyle, Metro, and Sports sections of tomorrow's newspaper, a total of six different photographs are to appear, exactly two photographs per section. Each of the available photographs was taken by one of three photographers: Fuentes, Gagnon, and Hue. Selection of the photographs is constrained by the following conditions: For each photographer, at least one but no more than three of that photographers photographs must appear. At least one photograph in the Lifestyle section must be by a photographer who has at least one photograph in the Metro section. The number of Hue's photographs in the Lifestyle section must be the same as the number of Fuentes photographs in the Sports section. None of Gagnon's photographs can be in the Sports section.
english.question: If both photographs in one of the three sections are by Gagnon, then which one of the following could be true?
options: (A)Both photographs in the Lifestyle section are by Hue.
(B)One photograph in the Lifestyle section is by Fuentes and one is by Hue.
(C)Both photographs in the Metro section are by Fuentes.
(D)One photograph in the Metro section is by Gagnon and one is by Hue.
(E)Both photographs in the Sports section are by Hue.
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (E)Both photographs in the Sports section are by Hue.
choices: (A)Both photographs in the Lifestyle section are by Hue.
(B)One photograph in the Lifestyle section is by Fuentes and one is by Hue.
(C)Both photographs in the Metro section are by Fuentes.
(D)One photograph in the Metro section is by Gagnon and one is by Hue.
(E)Both photographs in the Sports section are by Hue.
english.background: In the Lifestyle, Metro, and Sports sections of tomorrow's newspaper, a total of six different photographs are to appear, exactly two photographs per section. Each of the available photographs was taken by one of three photographers: Fuentes, Gagnon, and Hue. Selection of the photographs is constrained by the following conditions: For each photographer, at least one but no more than three of that photographers photographs must appear. At least one photograph in the Lifestyle section must be by a photographer who has at least one photograph in the Metro section. The number of Hue's photographs in the Lifestyle section must be the same as the number of Fuentes photographs in the Sports section. None of Gagnon's photographs can be in the Sports section.

chinese.question: 如果M是在秋天出版，那么以下哪一个是一对都可以在秋天和M一起出版的食谱？
chinese.label: MUL
chinese.background: 一家出版商计划在下一年内出版六本食谱-K、L、M、N、O和P。每本菜谱将在两个季节中的一个季节出版--秋季或春季--但须符合以下条件：M和P不能在同一季节出版。K和N必须在彼此的同一季节出版。如果K是在秋季出版的，O也必须在秋季出版。如果M在秋季出版，N必须在春季出版

english.passage: A publisher is planning to publish six cookbooks—K, L, M, N, O, and P—over the course of the next year. Each cookbook will be published in one of two seasons—fall or spring—subject to the following conditions: M and P cannot be published in the same season as each other. K and N must be published in the same season as each other. If K is published in the fall, O must also be published in the fall. If M is published in the fall, N must be published in the spring
english.question: If M is published in the fall, which one of the following is a pair of cookbooks that could both be published in the fall along with M?
options: (A)K and 0
(B)L and N
(C)L and 0
(D)N and P
(E)0 and P
english.label: MUL
english.answer: (C)L and 0
english.background: A publisher is planning to publish six cookbooks—K, L, M, N, O, and P—over the course of the next year. Each cookbook will be published in one of two seasons—fall or spring—subject to the following conditions: M and P cannot be published in the same season as each other. K and N must be published in the same season as each other. If K is published in the fall, O must also be published in the fall. If M is published in the fall, N must be published in the spring
